title._content: Unveiling N.Y. City's flag - Mitchel - Bakhuysen [i.e., Bakhuyzen], 6/24/15  (LOC)

description._content: Bain News Service,, publisher. Unveiling N.Y. City's flag - Mitchel - Bakhuysen [i.e., Bakhuyzen], 6/24/15 6/24/15 (date created or published later by Bain) 1 negative : glass ; 5 x 7 in. or smaller. Notes: Title and date from data provided by the Bain News Service on the negative. Photograph shows New York City Mayor John Purroy Mitchel (1879-1918) with Adrian van der Sande-Bakhuyzen (1874-1951), Consul-General of the Netherlands, who is presenting a flag to the city of New York to celebrate the 250th anniversary of the transition from Dutch to English rule. (Source: Flickr Commons project, 2012 and New York Times, June 23, 1915) Forms part of: George Grantham Bain Collection (Library of Congress). Format: Glass negatives. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print General information about the Bain Collection is available at hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.ggbain Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ggbain.19389 Call Number: LC-B2- 3525-9
